chapter.10.quest.1.description.1: For the most part, brewing works the same as in vanilla Minecraft. However, there are many more potions available to craft, which you can see via JEI. Additionally, players can craft potion charms to recieve powerful potion effects for a longer duration than usual, and these effects can even be made permanent via Infusion.
chapter.10.quest.1.title: Potion Brewing
chapter.10.quest.2.description.1:
Players can combine multiple potions together with Blaze Powder to create potion charms. These can be right-clicked to to turn them on or off, and will provide the player with the potion effect as long as it is active either in the player's inventory or charm slot. These charms can be enchanted with Unbreaking or mending to extend their duration.


&b&lUnbreakable Charms
Charms can be infused via an enchanting table to convert them into their unbreakable version. Unbreakable charms will provide their effects permanently, but can still be turned on and off. Infusing a charm requires maximum Eterna, between 8.5% and 13.5% Quanta, and between 85% and 95% Arcana. See the "Enchanting" Quest tab for more information about Infusions.
chapter.10.quest.2.task.1.title: Read
chapter.10.quest.2.title: Potion Charms
chapter.10.quest.3.description.1: Players can craft potion jars to store large amounts of one type of potion, a potion melder to combine the effects of potions, and potion flasks to store more doses of potion in a single bottle as well as increase the strength or extend the duration. View the "Magic" quest tab for more details for these devices and items.

&l&aWelcome to the Lost and Found!\n
Here, you will find replacements for all of DawnCraft's quest maps. Sometimes you might misplace a map, drop one somewhere. Normally, this would prevent you from progressing in your questline - but fear not!


Using this quest page, you can replace any quest map in the game. Simply click the check mark in any of these quests, and you will be given the map for the respective quest (repeatable, in case you are really bad at keeping track of things).

chapter.13.quest.11.description.1:
Notice the little dot around the edge of the map. That's you. The TOP of the map points to north; The LEFT of the map points to west; etc...
\nThere is sometimes a bug in Vanilla Minecraft where a cross is not shown in the map. In cases like this, you will need to look around the area that the map is located in.

chapter.13.quest.3.task.1.title: Info Books
chapter.13.quest.4.description.1:
GuildMaster is not a separate entity to villager. Instead, it is a profession, attainable by any villager (except nitwit). \n
The profession block (POI) is the bell commonly found in guild house or stalls. If you find a village with a stall without a guild master, try to wait till noon for villagers to start getting jobs. \n
You could also try to "guide" villagers to the bell, with whatever means possible within the realms of Minecraft.
chapter.13.quest.4.subtitle: Where can you find a guild master?
chapter.13.quest.4.task.1.title: Guild Master
chapter.13.quest.5.description.1:
The information is available in wiki. But one common mistake is that players loot containers that they did not place in front of villagers. This does not only apply to chests within villages. If there is a villager seeing you commit a 'crime' anywhere in the world, your reputation will decrease. 

The maximum amount of bundled currency you'll need to improve your reputation is 8. But that's very unlikely to happen, unless you were to massacre villages. Most of the time 1-2 bundled currencies will be enough.

However, if you feel that your low reputation is misjudged and would like to start out at 0 rep, turn on cheats and do 
/setreputation reputation:villager @p 0

Note that you will ALSO need a trading scroll on TOP of having enough reputation to trade with a villager. A trading scroll can be obtained via completing villager quests.
chapter.13.quest.5.subtitle: Why won't villagers interact with me?
chapter.13.quest.5.task.1.title: Reputation #1
chapter.13.quest.6.description.1:
Besides killing pillagers and Goblin King, all the other main quests are detected through the player picking up the ender eyes.
\nSo if you have killed one of the bosses (Eye Holders) beforehand and obtained the eye. All you have to do is drop the eye the Eye Holder held, then pick it up again. With that you should be able to complete the guildmaster's quest.

chapter.3.quest.2.description.1: Villages are of great importance. The Guild Master NPC, found in each village, will guide players through this modpack's main quest. This main quest is required to unlock enchanting, smithing, and other gear upgrades and automation. These quests will see players hunting bosses for their rare ender eye variants. The Guild Master's hut is also where you can check your villager reputation (via the reputation book) and donate emerald bundles (via the donation box). More on reputation in the next section.

chapter.3.quest.26.description.1:
This modpack will require you to travel thousands, or even tens of thousands of blocks to locate important structures, bosses, biomes and more. To assist in this task, there are several useful ways to get around, detailed in the below quests.
Many mods add additional ways to travel, which will be explained in their respective quest tabs, and finding gear with speed bonuses can also help.
chapter.3.quest.26.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.26.title: Traversal
chapter.3.quest.27.description.1: Gliders are a great way to traverse uneven landscapes. Find somewhere high up, and jump off. Using the glider will consume your stamina, so be careful not to run out, as you will fall from the sky. If you have low stamina, consider sticking to lower cliffs for now.
chapter.3.quest.28.description.1: The only way to increase your stamina is by using Spirit Orbs or Essence. These can be found in puzzle dungeons (large yellow or blue structures, containing a puzzle to complete) or some quests. Essence can be dropped by some mobs, such as ogres and Church Doctors, which spawn in the wild, and from some quests. Once obtained, right-click with the item to consume it. Once you have 4 orbs or 6 essence, speak to the appropriate statue in any village to exchange them for more health or stamina.
chapter.3.quest.28.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.28.title: Stamina
chapter.3.quest.29.description.1: As you explore, you will find Waystones in some villages. You can right-click on these (or break and re-place them first to set a new name) in order to save their location. Waystones can be warped between at the cost of experience, however crafting a Warp Stone will allow you unlimited teleports (on a cooldown) to any of your saved locations, from anywhere.
chapter.3.quest.3.description.1: Emerald Bundles can be donated to the Guild Master of any village to restore your reputation. These can be crafted with 8 emeralds and one leather. To donate, simply locate the Guild Master (a villager in blue clothes, who lives in a hut with red roof), and right-click the donation box on his counter with a bundle to donate. The player will need to sleep for the donation to take effect. Multiples may be needed to fully restore reputation. Reputation is lowered by looting chests or barrels in front of villagers or harming them. If your reputation is low, you cannot recieve quests or trades from villagers, or turn in existing quests.
chapter.3.quest.3.title: Reputation (and How to Restore it)
chapter.3.quest.30.description.1: In addition to being found in the world, Waystones can be crafted as well. This can be a great way to add a warp location to your home base, as well as for bringing one along during long journeys to allow for quick trips home and back by placing it, warping home, restocking/repairing, then warping back and picking it up again.
chapter.3.quest.31.description.1:
When first starting out, you will be outnumbered and underpowered. It's okay - that's the way it is supposed to be. You will no-doubt have to scavenge for your early-game gear, and will probably meet your death in the process. Be patient, explore, mine, craft, and follow the below steps to get your character on-track to best the most intimidating bosses.


Upon death, you will keep most of your items. However, you will drop some items (such as ores ,some materials, or currency), and these will be stored in a player corpse, which will despawn after 7 minutes. Death will also destroy some of your experience levels, as well as give you a debuff which will increase exp loss further for a period of time.
chapter.3.quest.31.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.31.title: The path to power
chapter.3.quest.32.description.1: The next step is finding gear with better stats. This can be achieved by looting chests, fighting monsters, and from some quests. This gear is more powerful, but once it breaks, it is gone for good, so use it sparingly until you have some extra gear lying around.
chapter.3.quest.32.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.32.title: Improving
chapter.3.quest.33.description.1: The first step to powering-up is to keep things safe - mine, craft, and do some light exploring. Crafted gear will not be as strong as found gear, but it will get the job done until you work your way up to something better.
chapter.3.quest.33.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.33.title: Scared and alone
chapter.3.quest.34.description.1: One of the most important factors in your combat success is your diet. Monsters hit hard and fast, and your health is sure to take a beating. Eating meals with high saturation will ensure that your HP regen lasts longer, and this can make the difference between life and death. Golden foods can help even more in this regard, though at a high price. Additionally, the diversity of your diet will apply buffs which can help you survive. See the "Cooking and Farming" quest tab for meal options. The Food Book (craftable, and obtained from this quest) will show you your current and possible meal buffs.
chapter.3.quest.34.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.34.title: Diet
chapter.3.quest.35.description.1: Skills can greatly improve your survivablity. Combat skills can be learned from guard villager quests. Seek out villages to obtain these useful skills. You can learn a skill by right-clicking a skillbook while holding it, and equip it via the "Skill Editor" menu (configurable).
chapter.3.quest.35.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.35.title: Skills
chapter.3.quest.36.description.1: This modpack's combat system is based around the Epic Fight Mod. Press "R" (configurable) to activate combat mode, which will allow you to use skills and do special attacks! However, in some cases you might still want to use vanilla attacks, such as when you're being grabbed by the Arachnarch from the EverDawn Dimension. Do note that vanilla attacks deal half as much damage as you would in combat mode, simply because you're not committing to your attacks.
chapter.3.quest.36.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.36.title: Combat Mode
chapter.3.quest.37.subtitle: You can find information about DawnCraft in this Book
chapter.3.quest.37.task.1.title: Let's get started!
chapter.3.quest.37.title: DawnCraft
chapter.3.quest.38.description.1:
Players can equip a number of additional items into special equipment slots.


&b&lCurios
The curios menu can be accessed by pressting the button at the top-left of the playe rportrait in the inventory menu. This will show all available Curio slots for rings, charms, and so-on. Some items can even add additional slots.


&b&lArcs
Arcs can be found in the dimensions added by the Blue Skies mod. This menu can be accessed via the Arcs tab to the left of the inventory screen.
chapter.3.quest.38.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.38.title: Trinkets and More
chapter.3.quest.39.description.1:
This modpack is meant to be played primarily in 3rd-person percpective. By default, you can switch perspectives with F5, but binding it to a key such as ~ can be a faster way to swap on the fly. 
The location of the crosshair relative to the player can be adjusted with the left and right arrow keys, and the camera can be zoomed in and out with up and down. Adjust these according to your preference. 
Combat mote can be enabled with R by default, however you may want to re-bind it to a different key, such as an extra mouse button if available.
chapter.3.quest.39.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.39.title: Camera and Hotkeys
chapter.3.quest.4.description.1: Trading contracts are required to trade with villagers. Before one can be used, a player must shift+click with one in their hand on a lectern to sign it, then right-click the appropriate villager with the signed contract to trade. If a player dies with a contract, it will need to be re-signed. Contracts can be obtained directly from villagers as a quest reward, or unlocked via the quests below. The below quests are much more expensive to complete, but remove the randomness of villager quests in exchange.
chapter.3.quest.4.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.4.title: Trading Contracts
chapter.3.quest.40.description.1:
1) You can cancel your forward movement while attacking by holding "S".


2) You have the weakness effect when your stamina bar is drained. Use your stamina sparingly.
\n3) Jump attacks do more damage to your enemies.
chapter.3.quest.40.task.1.title: Read
chapter.3.quest.40.title: Tip for Fighting
chapter.3.quest.5.reward.1.title: Claim trading contract
chapter.3.quest.5.title: Armorer Trading Contract
chapter.3.quest.6.reward.1.title: Claim trading contract
chapter.3.quest.6.title: Butcher Trading Contract
chapter.3.quest.7.reward.1.title: Claim trading contract
chapter.3.quest.7.title: Cartographer Trading Contract
chapter.3.quest.8.reward.1.title: Claim trading contract
chapter.3.quest.8.title: Cleric Trading Contract
chapter.3.quest.9.reward.1.title: Claim trading contract
chapter.3.quest.9.title: Farmer Trading Contract
chapter.3.title: Getting Started
chapter.4.quest.1.description.1: Basic chests will only get you so far in this modpack, as there are thousands of unique items, and you will quickly find yourself drowning in a sea of chests to sort. Luckily, there are mods included in this modpack which make sorting your treasures (and junk) much easier.
chapter.4.quest.14.description.1: Press B to open (by default). Can be equipped to your backpack equipment slot in the Curios menu.
chapter.4.quest.2.description.1: Storage Drawers are the perfect solution for when you need to store A LOT of one type of item. Great for things you will have a ton of and want easy access to (or discard of). These can be crafted in variants with additional drawers to store a few different stacks in one block, and can be upgraded to hold more stacks worth of items.
chapter.4.quest.2.title: Storage Drawers
chapter.4.quest.3.description.1: Cloud Storage can take some time to acquire the required materials, however it offers a very flexible storage system. Want one large storage network? Several smaller ones? Several large, seperate networks? Cloud storage can do it all - just be sure you aren't afraid of heights!
chapter.4.quest.3.task.1.title: Read
chapter.4.quest.3.title: Cloud Storage
chapter.4.quest.4.description.1: To get started with cloud storage, you will need balloon pieces to craft a balloon, and cloud blocks. Baloon mobs spawn above Y=196, as do cloud mobs, so you better find some mountains! It is not a bad idea to build a platform in the air to fight them more easily, and a bow certainly helps. Baloons drop pieces which can be crafted with string to make a balloon, and cloud mobs drop cloud blocks, which can be used to craft cloud chests.
chapter.4.quest.5.description.1: The last step to set up your cloud storage is to place a cloud chest anywhere directly beneath a sky block (not indoors!). Right-click it with a balloon, and its inventory will sync-up with all cloud chests of the same balloon color. Additional chests of the same balloon color will all connect to the same storage network.
chapter.4.quest.6.description.1: Static Balloons and Static Chests can be used to create a cloud inventory that can be accessed by all players. This is great for groups looking to share inventories. Static cloud blocks can be obtained by fighting cloud mobs during thunder storms. Place a static cloud block and right-click it with a balloon to charge the balloon. Craft the static cloud chest from static cloud blocks.
chapter.4.title: Storage
chapter.5.quest.1.description.1: Your first spell book marks the beginning of your magical journey. They can easily be crafted from some basic items. The worn notebook (craftable) has extensive information about all of the Ars Nouveau mod, but this quest line will give you an idea of the intended progression, as well as some essential items and functions. Magic is incredibly powerful, and some spells have been disabled to keep the modpack as balanced as possible.
chapter.5.quest.10.description.1: Generates source by consuming potions from adjacent potion jars. The amount of source varies per potion and is dependent on the complexity of the potion. Bonus source is given for the length and level of the potion with multipliers for each effect a potion contains.
chapter.5.quest.11.description.1: Generates source when nearby animals breed or die. Provides passive growth boost to baby animals nearby.
chapter.5.quest.12.description.1: Generates a moderate amount of source from nearby food, generating more for more nourishing food. Source Berry food is worth far more than other mundane foods. Additionally, the Mycelial Sourcelink will convert Grass or Dirt in the 3x3 below it into Mycelium and will grow mushrooms around it given that the space is empty. The Sourcelink will also pull items from nearby pedestals.
chapter.5.quest.13.description.1:
Drygmys are often found following and tending to animals around it. They can be found anywhere, though somewhat rarely. Drygmys can be given a home in the world, and will produce items from nearby monsters and animals as if they were slain, without harming them. A wild drygmy may be befriended by throwing a Wilden Horn near it (this creates a Drygmy Shard)! You may dye a Drygmy Cyan, Orange, or Brown.


Right-click a block of Mossy Cobblestone with a Drygmy Charm to summon it. The Mossy Cobblestone will turn into a drygmy altar. Source can be directed to the altar to power nearby Drygmys. Drygmys will automatically collect items and exp shards from nearby monsters and animals, and place them in a nearby chest. This is a great source for geenrating passive experience and items in place of a traditional mob farm. Items can be harvested through a one-block distance, allowing for different mobs to be fenced-in or encased completely.
chapter.5.quest.14.description.1:
Starbuncles naturally appear in wooded areas in search of golden nuggets. While Starbuncles are normally afraid of humans, they will allow someone to approach if they are holding a gold nugget. When a Starbuncle has picked up a golden nugget, it will vanish from this world and leave behind Starbuncle Shards.


&b&lSummoning
To summon a Starbuncle, use a Starbuncle charm on the ground. Summoned Starbuncles will pickup nearby items and can move items between inventories such as chests. Starbuncles will harvest Fully Grown Source Berry bushes around it. A Starbuncle will drop its charm when Dispelled or when killed. You may dye them using purple, red, yellow, orange, blue, or green dye.


&b&lItem Transport
To bind a Starbuncle to place items into a chest, use the dominion wand on the Starbuncle and then the inventory. To take items from an inventory, use the wand on the inventory and then the Starbuncle. Starbuncles will move items between as many inventories as you desire. Looking at a Starbuncle will tell you how many chests are being taken from, and input to. Using the Dominion Wand on a Starbuncle while sneaking will reset them.


&b&lFiltering
You may dictate where items go and may be picked up by using Item Scrolls or Item Frames. A Starbuncle may be given an Item Scroll: Allow or Deny, and will only pickup and move items respecting that filter. Alternatively, you may place an Item Frame on the inventory a Starbuncle is interacting with. You may either place an Item Scroll or a single item directly on the frame. Starbuncle interacting with that inventory will respect item framed filters.


&b&lPathing
Using a block on a Starbuncle will set them to prefer that block for pathing between areas, as long as it is on the way. They will also naturally prefer grass paths.


&b&lResting
Starbuncles may be bound to a Magebloom Bed using the Dominion Wand and will rest on the bed when there are no other tasks to be done. Useful for keeping them Out of the Way, or returning them to a spot where items drop.
chapter.5.quest.15.description.1:
Used to summon a Bookwyrm by right-clicking it on a lectern. Bookwyrms have no passive abilities, and only exist to be bound to the player as a familiar using the ritual of binding, which binds any nearby summoned mobs to the player as a familiar companion.  To begin summoning familiars, you will need to obtain a Bound Script of the entity you wish to befriend. These can be obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a relevant entity. Once you have obtained a Bound Script, use it to learn the familiar. Once you have obtained a bound script, you may access your list of familiars from your Spellbook crafting menu in the Familiars section. Selecting a Familiar will summon it in the world and give you Familiar Sickness, preventing you from summoning another one for a short time. To obtain your first familiar, perform the Ritual of Binding near a Starbuncle. Familiars are bound to the player.
When bound to the player, summoned mobs provide the following effects:
&b&lBookwyrm
A Bookwyrm will reduce the cost of all spells cast, and increases any spell damage by 1. Obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a Bookwyrm.
&b&lWixie
Wixies will increase the duration of potions that you apply, and wixies will accept basic potion reagents in exchange for applying the tier 1 potion result. Additionally, the Wixie will apply harmful potions to enemies during combat. Obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a Wixie.
&b&lDrygmy
A Drygmy familiar will increase the damage of Earth spells by 2, and has a chance to increase the amount of looting when slaying enemies. Obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a Drygmy.
&b&lStarbuncle
A Starbuncle familiar that will grant you Speed 2. Additionally, using a Golden Nugget on the starbuncle will consume it and grant the owner a short duration of Scrying for Gold Ore. Obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a Starbuncle.
&b&lWhirlisprig
Whirlisprigs will reduce the cost of Elemental Earth glyphs by half, and grants bonus saturation when consuming food. Obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a Whirlisprig.
chapter.5.quest.16.description.1:
A Wixie can automatically craft items for you at the expense of source. To obtain a Wixie Shard, cast Dispel on a Witch while it is half health or less. Once you have obtained a Wixie Charm, use it on a Cauldron to summon your Wixie. A Wixie can be dyed Red, White, Black, Blue, or Green.


&l&bItem Crafting
The Wixie will select the recipe for crafting based on the inventories nearby, you need not specify the exact materials for the recipe. For example, if you want to craft Sticks, the Wixie will mix and match planks from nearby chests in order to fulfill the recipe. Each craft requires a small amount of source and will be drained from nearby Source Jars. A redstone signal on The Cauldron will stop crafting.


&l&bMulti-Item Crafting
Wixies can craft multiple items at once by placing pedestals adjacent to The Cauldron. Wixie's will attempt to craft items in the pedestal, rotating round robin. Powering the pedestal will disable the wixie from crafting its item.


&l&bPotion Crafting
Wixies will autocraft potions using nearby Potion Jars and items. Potions that require Water will be supplied by the Wixie. Potions that require another potion as a base will be taken from nearby Potion Jars. A Wixie will output 3 doses of a Potion into a nearby Potion Jar when complete. To begin, place down an empty Potion Jar, right click The Cauldron with an Awkward Potion, and supply Nether Wart from a nearby chest.
chapter.5.quest.17.description.1:
Whirlisprigs are curious nature sprites that are exclusively found in forested areas. Summoned Whirlisprigs can be given a home in the world, and will begin producing natural materials including wood, crops, seeds, and flowers that exist around them. Wild Whirlisprigs can be befriended and will drop Whirlisprig Shards if a tree is grown near them.  To summon a Whirlisprig, use a Whirlisprig charm on any flower. Whirlisprigs consider their home to be 10 blocks in any direction from the flower. Whirlisprigs require source nearby to operate, and will only generate items if there is a chest placed next to the flower. You can get your charm back by using Dispel on a Whirlisprig. They may be given orange, yellow, white, or green dye.


&b&lHappiness
Summoned Whirlisprigs must be happy in order to produce materials, and their mood is determined by the number and diversity of natural materials in their home. You may use blocks on the Whirlisprig to gain additional info if a Whirlisprig would enjoy that block in their home. Interacting with the Whirlisprig with an empty hand will give you additional info on the Whirlisprig's happiness.


&b&lProduction
Drop rates are determined by happiness, diversity, and the proportions of blocks in a Whirlisprig home. For example, to generate a lot of logs, grow more trees. To gain more seeds and crop harvests, plant more crops.
chapter.5.quest.18.description.1:
Amethyst Golems will harvest, grow, and collect Amethyst near its home. To obtain an Amethyst Golem, perform the Ritual of Awakening near Budding Amethyst to obtain the Amethyst Golem Charm.


&b&lSummoning
Summon the Amethyst Golem by using a charm on a block. Before an Amethyst Golem will perform tasks, they must first have a home. Set their home by using the Dominion Wand on the golem, and then on a block. The golem's home is considered to be 10 blocks in any direction from the set position.


&b&lFarming Amethyst
Once a home has been set, the golem will begin performing tasks over time. They will convert Amethyst Blocks into Budding Amethyst, harvest Amethyst Clusters, speed up Budding Amethyst growth, and pick up and store Amethyst Shards.


&b&lStoring Amethyst
If a golem's home has been set to an inventory, golems will pick up and store Amethyst Shards in their bounded inventory block. If their home is not an inventory, they will simply ignore items on the ground.
chapter.5.quest.19.description.1: The starting point for all of your magical research. Placing blank glyphs on the table and right-clicking with your spellbook will present you with options for spells and upgrades that can be crafted.
chapter.5.quest.2.description.1: A more advanced spellbook. Unlocks higher level glyph crafting and spell augments.
chapter.5.quest.20.description.1: Found growing throughout the world in a variety of colors, Archwood Trees are an important resource for magical crafting. You will need to collect some Archwood before you can create many of the required magical items.
chapter.5.quest.20.task.1.title: Any #forge:logs/archwood
chapter.5.quest.20.title: Archwood
chapter.5.quest.21.description.1: Used for performing rituals. Use various items on a brazier to start the rituals. Consult the Worn Notebook to see the different types of rituals and required items.
chapter.5.quest.22.description.1: Source Berries can be eaten to restore health, or crafted into useful Mana Regeneration potions. Berries can be planted to grow more, and Source Berry bushes can be automatically harvested by Starbunkle familiars for easy automation of the Agronomic Sourcelink (see the familiars quests).
chapter.5.quest.22.title: Source Berries
chapter.5.quest.23.description.1: The necessary starting point for glyph creation. Once placed on a Scribe's Table, you can right-click with a spellbook to select the glyph you'd like to craft. Once selected, the required materials can be seen foating above the table. Toss the required materials onto the table to craft the glyph. Right-click with a glyph to learn it.
chapter.5.quest.24.description.1: The Volcanic Sourcelink generates Source by consuming burnable items. Archwood logs will generate bonus mana, with Blazing Archwood generating the most. As the Volcanic Sourcelink produces Source, it also produces heat, used for spawning Lava Lilies and converting stone into lava. The Volcanic Sourcelink automatically outputs to nearby jars, starting with the one closest to it.
chapter.5.quest.26.description.1: Used for directing various devices and familiars. Can link relays to sourcelinks, jars, and other devices. Can set home points for familiars. See the Worn Notebook for all functions.
chapter.5.quest.27.description.1:
Crafted using Magebloom. Magebloom can be grown from seeds crafted using the Enchanting Apparatus.
Can be upgraded to higher tiers of fiber by crafting it with other materials
chapter.5.quest.28.description.1: Weaker than iron. Mends its own durability over time by consuming mana. Increases max mana and mana regen by a small amount.
chapter.5.quest.29.description.1: Weaker than Diamond armor. Mends durability over time by consuming mana. Increases max mana and mana regen by a medium amount.
chapter.5.quest.3.description.1: The highest level spellbook. Unlocks all glyph crafting and spell augments.
chapter.5.quest.30.description.1: Weaker than netherite. Mends durability over time by consuming mana. Increases max mana and mana regan by a large amount.
chapter.5.quest.31.description.1: Occasionally grants a random positive potion effect for a short duration. These effects can vary in strength.
chapter.5.quest.32.description.1: A belt that allows the user levitate a moderate distance above the ground. Useful for climbing mountains! Simply sneak in the air while falling (or jumping) to rise. Reduces a small amount of fall damage while worn.
chapter.5.quest.33.description.1: Summons a light that will follow the user as they move. Can be summoned and dismissed at any time.
chapter.5.quest.34.description.1: In addition to providing a small bonus to maximum mana and mana regen, Rings of Discount reduce the total cost to cast a spell.
chapter.5.quest.35.description.1: Provides a slightly larger discount over the Lesser Ring of Discount.
chapter.5.quest.36.description.1: Increases max mana by a moderate amount.
chapter.5.quest.37.description.1: Increases mana regeneration by a moderate amount.
chapter.5.quest.38.description.1: A jar that can destroy items on pickup and grants a small amount of mana in return. To turn the jar on and off, use the jar while sneaking. To add or remove an item to be destroyed by the jar, use the jar with an item in the off hand, or use an item on the Scribes Table with the jar placed on it. The jar must be in your hotbar to function.
chapter.5.quest.39.description.1: Unimpressive items with great potential. Craft these with other materials in the Enchanting Apparatus to obtain useful trinkets.
chapter.5.quest.4.description.1: Your first magical machine. Place Lapis inside to create Source Gems. Works faster with source nearby.
chapter.5.quest.40.description.1: A special casting focus. Grants summons from spells additional duration, strength, speed, and deals damage to enemies that kill them. Additionally, casting spells that target you like Self and Orbit will cast a copy of the spell on your nearby summons.
chapter.5.quest.41.description.1: Wands accept only a single spell, and are inscribed using the Scribes Table. A Wand always starts with Projectile -> Accelerate, and MUST be inscribed with a spell that does not have another method. This allows you to cast spells beyond the 10 spell cap. If you want a wand that casts Break, inscribe the wand with JUST break, and your result will be a wand with Projectile -> Acclerate -> Break.
chapter.5.quest.42.description.1: A bow that can be inscribed with a spell using the Scribes Table. If the player has enough mana, arrows will become Spell Arrows and will apply the spell on their target. If no arrows are in the inventory, a spell arrow that deals 0 damage will be cast. If there is not enough mana, regular arrows will be fired. Enchanter's Bows may use special Augment Arrows for empowering the inscribed spell.
chapter.5.quest.43.description.1: Upon blocking damage, the user will gain a short duration of Mana Regeneration and Spell Damage. Additionally, this shield will repair over time using the wearers mana.
chapter.5.quest.44.description.1: Applies a Touch spell before damaging an entity. Additionally, all spells gain one additional Amplify augment on the last effect in the spell. Apply a spell at the Scribes Table that does NOT contain a form, such as Ignite -> Extend Time.
chapter.5.quest.45.description.1: Applies a self spell to the user. Spells cast with this mirror are discounted and gain additional bonus duration to all glyphs. Apply a spell at the Scribe's table that DOES NOT contain a form such as Strength -> Heal.
chapter.5.quest.46.description.1: A jar that stores up to 100 potions. Potion can be removed by using an Empty Bottle, Potion Flask, or Arrows on the jar. Wixies will use these jars during Potion Autocrafting. The jar may be locked by using a Dominion Wand while sneaking. Locked Jars will only receive the potion it is locked to from Wixies. Can be used with a Comparator.
chapter.5.quest.47.description.1: Converts three doses of a potion from two Potion Jars and outputs a potion with the combined effects. Use the Dominion Wand from a Potion Jar to Melder to link a jar for consumption. Link two input potion jars to the melder. Then, use the wand on the Melder and then to a third jar to set the output. The Potion Melder requires source per mix.
chapter.5.quest.48.description.1:
A flask that stores 8 charges of a potion. To fill the flask, use the flask on a Potion Jar, or craft the flask in a Crafting Table with another potion. You may empty the flask by using the flask on a Potion Jar while sneaking.
Crafted in the enchanting apparatus.
chapter.5.quest.49.description.1:
Crafted by enchanting a potion flask in an Enchanting Apparatus
Extends the time of effects by 50%
chapter.5.quest.5.description.1: The most basic device for generating source. Place near growing crops to generate source. A source jar can be placed nearby to store generated source.
chapter.5.quest.50.description.1:
Crafted by enchanting a potion flask in an Enchanting Apparatus
 Increases the power of effects by 1, but reduces their time in half.
chapter.5.quest.6.description.1: An important item for crafting magical items. Place it into the ground 1 block so that an Enchanting Apparatus can be placed on top of it.
chapter.5.quest.7.description.1: Used to craft magical items. Place on top of an Arcane Core block to function. Requires pedestals to add crafting materials (see next quest).
chapter.5.quest.8.description.1:
Place adjacent to an Enchanting Apparatus which is on an Arcane Core. Up to 8 can be placed surrounding the Apparatus. Place materials on the pedastals first, then place the item you plan to enchant into the Enchanting Apparatus to begin crafting. Recipes can be found in JEI or the Worn Notebook.


Some recipes may also require source, which will be gathered from nearby jars
chapter.5.quest.9.description.1: Stores source generated by nearby sourcelinks.
chapter.5.title: Magic
chapter.6.quest.1.description.1: Welcome to Hexerei! Through this quest chain, you will learn all that you need to know about practicing witchcraft.
chapter.6.quest.1.task.1.title: Read
chapter.6.quest.1.title: Welcome to Hexerei
chapter.6.quest.10.description.1: Used to dry herbs and herb-based items. Right-click with an item to hang it, and sneak+right-click to remove it.
chapter.6.quest.11.description.1: Place on an incense plate to burn. Keeps mobs from spawning in a radius. See the edge of the affected zone via a "smoke ring" effect that can be seen around the affected area. Can be picked up to pause the burning effect, and started again at a later time. Great for keeping bases safer throughout the night.
chapter.6.quest.12.description.1: Place dried sage bundles on this plate and light with flint and steel.
chapter.6.quest.13.description.1: Fill a lava-filled cauldron with sand to craft. Can store a very large number of one kind of any plant or herb. sneak-click to open storage, or click with a herb or plant to store it. Punch to withdraw, or sneak+punch to withdraw a full stack. Can be labelled in an anvil. Can be picked up like a shulker box and placed back down while still storing items.
chapter.6.quest.14.description.1:
Stores items, and displays them visually. Can be picked up along with contents like a shulker box.
Craft with dye to color.
chapter.6.quest.15.description.1:
Allows flight! 


Sneak+right-click to open the broom menu. From here, you can customize your broom and change its settings (hover or land). IMPORTANT: If you fall off of a broom mid-flight and it is in hover mode, it will stay up there! You will have an easier time retrieving brooms in "land" mode... unless it lands in water...


Brooms are steered similarly to a boat. Right-click to mount, shift+right-click to dismount. Hold space to fly, or sneak to descend.
Punch repeatedly to break and pick-up.
chapter.6.quest.16.subtitle: Faster, more durable, fire resistant.
chapter.6.quest.17.description.1: Helps find swamps and jungles for important witchcraft crafting items. Hold shift while hovering over the item for a detailed description.
chapter.6.quest.18.description.1: Bottled blood. Hold shift while hovering over the item for more detail. Used in some crafting recipes.
chapter.6.quest.19.description.1: Add to the "Bag" slot of your broom. Adds storage capacity to your broom.
chapter.6.quest.2.description.1:
Your basic witchcraft cauldron. This will be where you craft most of your items. 


Use of this block is locked behind completion of a specific Cleric Villager quest. The knowledge required to use cauldrons can instead be unlocked in a quest found above, however the price is steep...


&b&lUseage:
Cauldrons can hold various types of liquid, which can be poured into it directly. Some crafting recipes may also change the liquid stored into a diffent kind, which may be needed for other recipes. Additional materials needed for a crafting recipe can be tossed into the cauldron, or added via the the menu accessed by right-clicking the cauldron. Once the required materials are added, the finished item can be retreived by right-clicking the cauldron to access the crafting menu.
chapter.6.quest.22.description.1: Decorative rings for your broom. Add them to the "Decoration" slot.
chapter.6.quest.23.description.1: Decorative item for your broom. Craft with any item to create a keychain of that item (the item will be consumed!). Add to your broom's "Decoration" slot to display a keychain of the chosen item.
chapter.6.quest.24.description.1: Placed in the broom's "Brush" slot. Allows the broom to operate. Degrades over time. Can be enchanted to improve durability.
chapter.6.quest.26.description.1: Add to the "Broom Tip" slot of your broom's menu. Improves water resistance. Loses durability gradually in water. Allows flight in water.
chapter.6.quest.27.description.1: Improves brooms fire-resistance. Allows flight in lava.
chapter.6.quest.28.description.1: Various herbs can be found in swamp biomes. These are required for many witchcraft recipes.
chapter.6.quest.29.description.1: Used to grind seeds into seed mixture for crow taming.
chapter.6.quest.3.description.1:
Hexerei Cauldrons require knowledge level 2 to use. This can be obtained through a Cleric Villager quest, however those who are having trouble finding this quest or who have failed to complete it can instead purchase the knowledge here, for a price...
\nNote: As of right now the book of shadows crashes clients if the client is using shaders.
chapter.6.quest.3.reward.1.title: Cauldron Knowledge Level 2
chapter.6.quest.3.title: Unlocking the Knowledge of Cauldrons
chapter.6.quest.30.description.1: Crafted in a pestle and mortar. Feed to wild crows for a chance to tame them. Crows can be found in most biomes, such as forests and swamps. See the "Crow Flute" quest next for a full guide on crow useage.
chapter.6.quest.31.description.1:
Crows can be tamed by feeding them Seed Mixture. Once tamed, they can be controlled using a Crow Flute.


Sneak-Right click a crow familair to access its menu. From here, you can change its follow mode, behavior, and equip various decorative items.


&b&lFollow Mode
By setting a follow mode, you can change how the crow follows the player. It can follow/perch on the player's shoulder, wander or sit. Set the crow to "Help" mode to enable its gathering functions.


&b&lGathering
Crows in gather mode will collect nearby items and place them in a nearby coffer. The items types you wish to gether must already be present in the coffer. Crows must be set to perch on a coffer in order to deposit items (see "Crow Flute" section).


&b&lHarvesting
Crows in harvest mode will harvest nearby crops. This includes naturally generated crops and some plants (such as Hexerei plants found in swamp biomes). Can be combined with gathering crows to fully automate your farm. Best used with the crow flue (see below).


&b&lCrow Flute
Sneak+right-click while holding the crow flute to access the flute menu. This menu is similar to the crow menu, but can be used to select and command multiple crows, as well as set home points for individual or groups of crows. Choosing the "Seclect" option will allow you to right-click crows with the flute to select or de-select them. Switching to "Perch" mode will allow you to set a perch location for all currently selected crows. Changing any of the follow/help settings will change those settings for all selected crows at once. Great for directing larger numbers of crows at once, and the only way to set crow perch locations. Right-click with the flute to activate the selected function.


&b&lThieving
Crows in theiving mode will steal from nearby villagers, and drop the stolen items at their perch location. Set them to perch on a hopper for easy chest depositing. Steals a variety of items, including emeralds. Crows will fly around after thieving before depositing to evade detection.


&b&lBreeding
Multiple tamed crows can be given gold nuggets to breed.
chapter.6.quest.31.title: Crow Taming
chapter.6.quest.32.description.1: Crafted in a cauldron, infused fabric is essential for crafting your witch's uniform.
chapter.6.quest.33.description.1: The witchs uniform. Slightly stronger than iron armor, and provides a number of useful effects. Allows the player to blend in with witches.
chapter.6.quest.4.description.1: A cauldron upgrade, which allows you to add blood to your recipes for items wich require it. Simply place the sigil inside of the cauldron via the sigil slot in the cauldron crafting GUI, then jump inside to create blood. Jumping more will add more blood. Other liquid and materials can be added as usual. Usual recipes which do not require blood can still be crafted while the sigil is in the cauldron.
chapter.6.quest.5.description.1: Place 6 animal fat and 2 honeycomb into a cauldron filled with water to produce tallow. Used for the creation of candles.
chapter.6.quest.6.description.1: Place on a cauldron filled with tallow to use. Add strings to the dipper by right-clicking with them to begin dipping candles.
chapter.6.quest.7.description.1: Wow! It's a candle! Can be dyed and used as a decorative block. Light with a flint and steel for light with a limited duration. Can be used to craft candelabras. Multiple candles can be placed together on the same block.
chapter.6.quest.8.description.1: A decorative light. Can be lit for a limited time. Can be placed on a solid block or hung from a chain. Automatically connects to above chain blocks.
chapter.6.quest.9.description.1: A basic herb. Can be found in swamps and other biomes, or grown from sage seeds which are commonly dropped by grass and plants.

chapter.7.quest.16.description.1: Crafted from a Witch's Eye, dropped rarely from Witches, or found in their treasure.

chapter.7.quest.18.description.1: Guarded by the Cleric Villagers, found as a rare, high-level trade.

chapter.7.title: Exploration
chapter.8.quest.1.description.1:
Enchanting in DawnCraft works very differently from vanilla minecraft. For starters, you will need enchanting knowledge lv2. This is obtained from the Guild Master's main quest line (specifically, the quest to defeat the Nine Tails boss). 


There are 3 new values which effect the quality of your enchantments - Eterna, Quanta and Arcana. The number of enchantment clues can also be affected. See below for descriptions of each.


&b&lEterna
Represents how strong your enchantment is, increasing the level cost. Only blocks surrounding the enchanting table one-block away and two-blocks high will affect enchantment values. Enchantment levels can reach up to 100 (rather than the vanilla 30), allowing for rarer and higher-level enchantments than usual.


&b&lQuanta
Affects the potential power and variance of the enchantmenr. High quanta can lead to large boosts in enchantment quality, however you also risk getting lower level enchantments or even curses if you are unlucky. "Rectification" can be added via certain blocks to reduce the potential negative effects of quanta, making it a purely beneficial stat. An amount of quanta is always good to have, even without rectification.


&b&lArcana
Increases the number of enchantments and makes rare enchantments more common.
chapter.8.quest.1.title: Enchanting in DawnCraft
chapter.8.quest.10.description.1: An unusual shelf, decreases Eterna but adds maximum chaos.
chapter.8.quest.11.description.1: An unusual booskelf. Decreases Eterna slightly, but makes enchanting less random.
chapter.8.quest.12.description.1:
Can store a large number of enchanted books in one location. Combines enchanted books automatically, and enchanted books can be withdrawn at any available strength easily. A must-have for enchanters with storage problems.
Can save you a significant amount of exp when combining enchantments.
chapter.8.quest.14.description.1: The ultimate enchantment storage and combination solution.
chapter.8.quest.15.description.1: An infused version of a Seashelf. To infuse a shelf, place it in an ehcnating table while you meet the required levels and enchanting stats. To see the requirements, click on the item image here, or search in JEI.
chapter.8.quest.16.description.1: An infused version of the Hellshelf. To infuse, place the shelf in the enchanting table while you meet the required levels and enchanting stats (seen by clicking the infused hellshelf here, or in JEI).
chapter.8.quest.18.description.1: An upgraded Infused Hellshelf. provides increased stats.
chapter.8.quest.19.description.1: An upgraded version of the Infused Seashelf. Provides higher stats.
chapter.8.quest.2.description.1: Your most basic enchanting item. Can provide a max of 15 Eterna, allowing for enchantments up to lv30. Provides no Quanta or Arcana benefits. Fewer than the vanilla number are required before the maximum is reached, so can be mixed with other items to gain more Quanta and Arcana until higher level bookshelves are available.
chapter.8.quest.21.description.1: Adds a significant amount of Eterna, but no other stats. Good for mixing with other bookshelves to reach max Eterna quickly.
chapter.8.quest.23.description.1: Adds Rectification to your enchanting setup. Rectification decreases the potential for quanta to curse items or offer lower-level enchantments. Max Rectification turns Quanta into a purely beneficial stat. Rectification level can be see when hovering over an enchantment in the enchanting GUI.
chapter.8.quest.25.description.1: Provides a high level of Rectification
chapter.8.quest.26.description.1: Various tomes can be crafted, such as "Tome of Miners", "Tome of Helmets", and so-on. Search these in JEI to see all available tomes and recipes. These can be enchanted similarly to books, but will only recieve enchantments available to the appropriate tome (eg. a Tome of Helmets will only recieve viable helmet enchantments).
chapter.8.quest.26.task.1.title: Read
chapter.8.quest.26.title: Tomes
chapter.8.quest.27.description.1: Can consume an item to transfer some enchantments to itself. Used in an anvil. Can be a good way of moving enchantments from one item to another, but you never know exactly what you will get...
chapter.8.quest.28.description.1: Can remove curses from an item. Used in an anvil with a cursed item. Consumes levels on use.
chapter.8.quest.3.description.1: Can be placed surrounding the enchanting table one-block away and up to two-blocks high to add a small amount of Arcana. There is no limit beyond how many you can fit. Placing multiple on the same block provides no additional benefit.
chapter.8.quest.4.description.1: Can be placed one-block away from the enchanting table, up to two-blocks high to add a small amount of Quanta. Good for mixing with bookshelves and candles early game to gain a better mix of enchanting potential.
chapter.8.quest.5.description.1: Provides a larger amount of Quanta than skulls, but can be difficult to acquire.
chapter.8.quest.6.description.1:
An upgraded bookshelf which add increased Eterna and some Quanta. Increases maximum Eterna.
Can be mixed with Seashelves for more balanced enchanting.
chapter.8.quest.7.description.1:
An upgraded bookshelf which provides Greater Eterna and some Arcana.
Increases max Eterna.
Can be mixed with Hellshelves for more balanced enchanting.
chapter.8.quest.8.description.1: The highest tier of bookshelf. Adds a higher, balanced spread of stats.
chapter.8.quest.9.description.1: Reveals more enchantment results in the enchanting table.
chapter.8.title: Enchanting
chapter.9.quest.1.description.1: Equipment in DawnCraft can be upgraded by reforging its quality, as well as socketing gems into the equipment. This quest chain will explain the mechanics of salvaging materials from equipment, reforging equipment, and socketing/removing gems.
chapter.9.quest.1.task.1.title: Read
chapter.9.quest.1.title: Reforging and Socketing
chapter.9.quest.13.description.1: Forged with an item in a Smithing Table, extracts gems from the equipment, destroying the equipment in the process.
chapter.9.quest.14.description.1: Forged with an item in a Smithing Table to remove gems from the equipment, destroying them in the process.
chapter.9.quest.2.description.1: Used to socket gems into equipment. Equipment must have empty equipment slots to socket gems.
chapter.9.quest.3.description.1: Uses rarity materials obtained from the Salvaging Table, and Gem Dust obtained by crushing Gems to re-forge gear. Reforginc can re-roll the stats for a piece of equipment with the same rarity, or can change the rarity of a piece of equipment (even a piece that has no rarity already).
chapter.9.quest.4.description.1: Used to salvage materials used for reforging from equipment. The material amount provided is random, and the material type corresponds to the rarity of the salvaged equipment.
chapter.9.quest.5.description.1:
Can be added to an item via the Smithing Table to add an additional socket (Max. 3 sockets)
Can be obtained by crafting, or rarely from quests or treasure.
chapter.9.quest.6.description.1:
An upgraded Sigil of Socketing, obtained by infusion (see Enchanting quest tab for more info).
Can be used to add a socket to an item, up to a maximum of 4.
chapter.9.quest.7.description.1: Obtained by crushing gems. To crush a gem, toss it (or multiple) on the ground. Then, place an anvil above the gems at least one-block above, causing it to fall, crushing the gems into dust. Many gems can be crushed at once this way. Each drop will damage the anvil slightly.
chapter.9.title: Reforging and Socketing
